thread.title: Arizona prep forward Mitch Lightfoot to play basketball for Jayhawks
thread.title_full: Arizona prep forward Mitch Lightfoot to play basketball for Jayhawks

author: Gary Bedore
title: Arizona prep forward Mitch Lightfoot to play basketball for Jayhawks
text:
By Gary Bedore — Lawrence Journal-World October 24, 2015 
Advertisement 
Mitch Lightfoot, a 6-foot-9, 210-pound senior power forward from Gilbert (Arizona) Christian High, has orally committed to play basketball at Kansas University next season. 
Lightfoot, who averaged 17.9 points, 9.7 rebounds, 6.8 steals and 4.8 blocks a game last season for Arizona’s Div. II state championship team, is currently ranked No. 117 in the Class of 2016 by Rivals.com. 
He made the announcement Saturday after the slam dunk contest at the Arizona Preps Fall Showcase in Glendale, Arizona. 
"The best decision for me is to be a Kansas Jayhawk," he said in an announcement broadcast on Periscope. 
He chose KU over Arizona, Stanford, Utah and St. John’s. Lightfoot was born in Kansas City, moving to Arizona when he was 6. He lived in Tucson until last year when the family moved to Gilbert. 
More on the commitment at kusports.com and in Sunday’s Journal-World.
